title: [Large-Scale] Practical Training on VR-Based Visual Function Training System Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of visual systems and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Enhancing operational and analytical capabilities of visual training systems using VR devices in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Perform visual function assessments using AI-based iris and pupil tracking technology in a VR environment.

Learners diagnose visual impairment types (e.g., hemianopia, visual field loss) in stroke patients within 3 weeks. They design one personalized visual training program including 3 core elements (goal setting, training methods, evaluation metrics) and analyze treatment efficacy by applying a visual tracking accuracy measurement process to 5 virtual patient datasets, demonstrating ≥15% average improvement.

Learners analyze visual impairment diagnostic data (visual acuity, intraocular pressure, retinal images) to establish ≥3 prevention/treatment plans (medication, laser therapy, rehabilitation training) and create patient-specific management checklists within 2 weeks.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
